alert.note: Alert for Bandera; Bastrop; Blanco; Burnet; Caldwell; Comal; Edwards; Gillespie; Hays; Kendall; Kerr; Lee; Llano; Real; Travis; Williamson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 03 at 7:59PM CST until February 04 at 9:00AM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Hazardous travel conditions. Ice and sleet accumulations remain on area roadways after wintry precipitation has come to an end across the warned area. Additionally, black ice may develop tonight. Reports of accidents and numerous roads remain closed or heavily impacted by icy conditions. Wind chills ranging as low as 5 below zero in the Hill Country to 5 above zero elsewhere through 9 AM Friday. * WHERE...Portions of south central Texas. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 10 AM CST Friday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 9 AM CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult on untreated roads, especially elevated bridges, overpasses, and roadways. The hazardous conditions could impact the Friday morning commute. Side walks and pavement will be slippery to walk on. In addition, the risk for hypothermia exists for those spending extended time outdoors and not dressed in layers and gloves.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state can be obtained at drivetexas.org. A Wind Chill Advisory means that very cold air and strong winds will combine to generate low wind chills. This will result in frost bite and lead to hypothermia if precautions are not taken. If you must venture outdoors...make sure you wear a hat and gloves.
